columns.name: instance_id
columns.description: The ID of the instance.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the instance.

columns.name: instance_type
columns.description: The instance type.

columns.name: instance_state
columns.description: The state of the instance (pending | running | shutting-down | terminated | stopping | stopped).

columns.name: monitoring_state
columns.description: Indicates whether detailed monitoring is enabled (disabled | enabled).

columns.name: disable_api_termination
columns.description: If the value is true, instance can't be terminated through the Amazon EC2 console, CLI, or API.

columns.name: ami_launch_index
columns.description: The AMI launch index, which can be used to find this instance in the launch group.

columns.name: architecture
columns.description: The architecture of the image.

columns.name: boot_mode
columns.description: The boot mode of the instance.

columns.name: capacity_reservation_id
columns.description: The ID of the Capacity Reservation.

columns.name: capacity_reservation_specification
columns.description: Information about the Capacity Reservation targeting option.

columns.name: client_token
columns.description: The idempotency token you provided when you launched the instance, if applicable.

columns.name: cpu_options_core_count
columns.description: The number of CPU cores for the instance.

columns.name: cpu_options_threads_per_core
columns.description: The number of threads per CPU core.

columns.name: ebs_optimized
columns.description: Indicates whether the instance is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O. This optimization provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized configuration stack to provide optimal I/O performance. This optimization isn't available with all instance types.

columns.name: ena_support
columns.description: Specifies whether enhanced networking with ENA is enabled.

columns.name: hypervisor
columns.description: The hypervisor type of the instance. The value xen is used for both Xen and Nitro hypervisors.

columns.name: iam_instance_profile_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of IAM instance profile associated with the instance, if applicable.

columns.name: iam_instance_profile_id
columns.description: The ID of the instance profile associated with the instance, if applicable.

columns.name: image_id
columns.description: The ID of the AMI used to launch the instance.

columns.name: instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior
columns.description: Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiate shutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).

columns.name: instance_lifecycle
columns.description: Indicates whether this is a spot instance or a scheduled instance.

columns.name: kernel_id
columns.description: The kernel ID

columns.name: key_name
columns.description: The name of the key pair, if this instance was launched with an associated key pair.

columns.name: launch_time
columns.description: The time the instance was launched.

columns.name: outpost_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost, if applicable.

columns.name: placement_affinity
columns.description: The affinity setting for the instance on the Dedicated Host.

columns.name: placement_availability_zone
columns.description: The Availability Zone of the instance.

columns.name: placement_group_id
columns.description: The ID of the placement group that the instance is in.

columns.name: placement_group_name
columns.description: The name of the placement group the instance is in.

columns.name: placement_host_id
columns.description: The ID of the Dedicated Host on which the instance resides.

columns.name: placement_host_resource_group_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances.

columns.name: placement_partition_number
columns.description: The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances.

columns.name: placement_tenancy
columns.description: The tenancy of the instance (if the instance is running in a VPC). An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware.

columns.name: platform
columns.description: The value is 'Windows' for Windows instances; otherwise blank.

columns.name: platform_details
columns.description: The platform details value for the instance.

columns.name: private_ip_address
columns.description: The private IPv4 address assigned to the instance.

columns.name: private_dns_name
columns.description: The private DNS hostname name assigned to the instance. This DNS hostname can only be used inside the Amazon EC2 network. This name is not available until the instance enters the running state.

columns.name: public_dns_name
columns.description: The public DNS name assigned to the instance. This name is not available until the instance enters the running state.

columns.name: public_ip_address
columns.description: The public IPv4 address, or the Carrier IP address assigned to the instance, if applicable.

columns.name: ram_disk_id
columns.description: The RAM disk ID.

columns.name: root_device_name
columns.description: The device name of the root device volume (for example, /dev/sda1).

columns.name: root_device_type
columns.description: The root device type used by the AMI. The AMI can use an EBS volume or an instance store volume.

columns.name: source_dest_check
columns.description: Specifies whether to enable an instance launched in a VPC to perform NAT. This controls whether source/destination checking is enabled on the instance.

columns.name: spot_instance_request_id
columns.description: If the request is a Spot Instance request, the ID of the request.

columns.name: sriov_net_support
columns.description: Indicates whether enhanced networking with the Intel 82599 Virtual Function interface is enabled.

columns.name: state_code
columns.description: The reason code for the state change.

columns.name: state_transition_reason
columns.description: The reason for the most recent state transition.

columns.name: state_transition_time
columns.description: The date and time, the instance state was last modified.

columns.name: subnet_id
columns.description: The ID of the subnet in which the instance is running.

columns.name: tpm_support
columns.description: If the instance is configured for NitroTPM support, the value is v2.0.

columns.name: usage_operation
columns.description: The usage operation value for the instance.

columns.name: usage_operation_update_time
columns.description: The time that the usage operation was last updated.

columns.name: user_data
columns.description: The user data of the instance.

columns.name: virtualization_type
columns.description: The virtualization type of the instance.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC in which the instance is running.

columns.name: block_device_mappings
columns.description: Block device mapping entries for the instance.

columns.name: elastic_gpu_associations
columns.description: The Elastic GPU associated with the instance.

columns.name: elastic_inference_accelerator_associations
columns.description: The elastic inference accelerator associated with the instance.

columns.name: enclave_options
columns.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for Amazon Web Services Nitro Enclaves.

columns.name: hibernation_options
columns.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for hibernation.

columns.name: launch_template_data
columns.description: The configuration data of the specified instance.

columns.name: licenses
columns.description: The license configurations for the instance.

columns.name: maintenance_options
columns.description: The metadata options for the instance.

columns.name: metadata_options
columns.description: The metadata options for the instance.

columns.name: network_interfaces
columns.description: The network interfaces for the instance.

columns.name: private_dns_name_options
columns.description: The options for the instance hostname.

columns.name: product_codes
columns.description: The product codes attached to this instance, if applicable.

columns.name: security_groups
columns.description: The security groups for the instance.

columns.name: instance_status
columns.description: The status of an instance. Instance status includes scheduled events, status checks and instance state information.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the instance.
